reviewText:
If you've played a previous RBI baseball game, this is more of the same

Arcade controls, overall lacks depth, no career mode (single season + playoffs only)

Pitching is shallow: you can throw a fastball or a slowball, and you can control if the ball goes inside or outside the plate. No pitcher specific pitches, so no high heat from your closer followed by a nasty slider.

The presentation is, again, shallow. Very little to no commentary, the splash screen between innings is pretty bad. It's somewhere they could have easily put some work into, but didn't.

Team management is absent: no trades, no AAA promotions, no FA.

It is a real MLB game though: stadiums, uniforms (including throw-backs), and players are all here.

Overall very simple to control, you can pick it up and play it easily.

Has both online and local multi-player.

At this price, and considering it is the only MLB licensed game on PC atm, it's worth playing if you need to scratch that baseball itch.

Wish there was a neutral vote for game rating. It's not a bad game, it's just not a great game. It doesn't seem fair to hold not being a AAA title against it when it only cost $19.99.

reviewText: If you played previous years of R.B.I Baseball this game will feel very familiar to you. It plays very much the same if not exactly the same. Automatic dives and jumps have been added this year, which is a good thing. I was really hoping for the ability to make trades during season mode. Currently that isn't an option. I was also hoping for injuries or fatigue for the fielders. Sadly both are lacking again this year. All the fields are there as well as the players. I enjoyed last year's game and I enjoy this one. Can I recommend it? Yes, if you're looking for a baseball game on the PC platform. No, if you're looking for an all out in-depth baseball sim. This is NOT The Show by any stretch. It is, like previous years, an arcade style baseball game.
voteText: 15 of 22 people (68%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
As a fan (and owner) of the original RBI Baseball from the Nintendo days, I am very pleased with this game. Has all the nostalgic nods to the old days and brings it to today. It feels and plays just like I remember it. Was able to just jump right in and get at it. Of course, there are quite a few improvements over the NES version of yester years with authentic MLB rosters and stats along with pretty good renders of the actual stadiums (that I have seen so far). Takes a bit of time to get use to the speed of the pitching and controlling your fielders, but I know this will be one I will enjoy as the season goes on.

Those of you looking for an experience like MLB The Show, keep moving. This is by no means a complete MLB simulation game. Graphics are smooth and purdy, but I care more for gameplay than I do how good it looks.

This was my first time playing any of the new RBI Baseball games that started in 2014, and I am happy with my purchase. Cant wait to get more in tune with the controlls and timing so that I may get my taste of online ranked matches.

In short, if you loved the original RBI Baseball on the NES, this will not dissapoint. PLAY BALL!!!! GO ASTROS!!!!

reviewText:
I love the RBI Baseball games on Steam and 16 is no exception. It has working multiplayer which is rare in the baseball genre on the PC. It's best to have friends on your list to play the game against. Finding random players is rare because the playerbase is so small.

Aside from that, there have been overall improvements to the game. Graphics look much better than in 15 and the pitching is fixed. Batting system has been improved. New fielding moves (automatic). The AI has been revamped and has downloadable roster updates as the season progresses.

This game is arcadey, fast paced and simplistic. Don't let the word simplistic fool you though, it's still a lot of fun.

My only gripes are the Max FPS not having a disable option (as it is now you can only choose 30fps or 60fps) and when enabling v-sync the game suffers from a bit of studder\lag. We need an option to disable Max FPS. Also, V-Sync seems like it needs more work and be polished up some.
voteText: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Enjoyable simple little arcade baseball. Plays like an old console game but with pleasant yet rudimentary visuals. Easy to pick a team and get right into it but don't expect much depth.

I'm fairly new to baseball having moved to America recently and am playing the game as a means of learning the finer points of the game. Roster will update online so if accurate rosters are important to you, that'll keep you happy.

I wanted a straightforward baseball game that was easy to wrap my head around and that's exactly what this is.
